description.narrative:
Advancing the rights of children in crises. The funds are for activities in humanitarian crises prioritised by Denmark and for UNICEF global support to humanitarian crises. The agreement corresponds with "The World 2030". The overall aim of the Thematic Fund for Humanitarian Action will be faster scale-up and better results in major humanitarian crises. More is specified in the SPA-agreement 2017-2019 and the yearly commitments that are subject to parliamentary approval. 2017: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level 2018: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level 2019: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level and 20 Million for Transformative Humanitarian funding.
The partner’s results description and results frameworks are global, general, and highly aggregated and the MFA core contribution is thus reflected in the overall results reporting by the partner. Please refer to the hyperlink below.
https://www.unicef.org/research-and-reports

To advancing the rights of children in crises. The funds are for activities in humanitarian crises prioritised by Denmark and for UNICEF global support to humanitarian crises.
The agreement corresponds with "The World 2030". The overall aim of the Thematic Fund for Humanitarian Action will be faster scale-up and better results in major humanitarian crises. More is specified in the SPA-agreement 2017-2019 and the yearly commitments that are subject to parliamentary approval.
2017: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level 2018: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level 2019: 40 Million to be allocated through the humanitarian funding window at country level and 20 Million for Transformative Humanitarian funding.
